page.title: 17ST FITTICK'S WELL
page.content: St Fittick's Well used to be on the beach at Nigg Bay where freshwater gurgled up and flowed down into the sea.Sadly the well has now disappeared due to the continual process of coastal erosion. St Fittick was a French Saint of Scots descent who had been sent to preach to the Picts by the Bishop of Meaux.When his boat was caught in a storm he was swept overboard and cast up on the shore of Nigg.He originally found the well later to be named after him. The well became famous for its curative powers and twice a year on the first Sunday in May and on 30th August, St Fittick's Day, local people would make a pilgrimage to this well, though this practise gradually ceased as religous beliefs changed.
